result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laquetta E Brooks

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Laquetta E Brooks
Current: 9217 N 75TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53223 United States  (Effective: 11-04-2022)
Prior: 9217 North 75th Street #214, Milwaukee, WI 53223

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MW, AW, and Denny's Restaurants. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Laquetta E Brooks in court. Student Intern Madaline Witte under the supervision of Attorney Sarah Dahdouh  in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  

The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 11/4/22 @ 1:30p
